p: Overall, increased temperature of 2°C negatively impacted the longevity of the Ae. aegypti populations while Ae. albopictus were not affected. The higher survival capacity of Ae. albopictus both in the field and laboratory settings could contribute to these differences. Since [ 38] showed a wider temperature tolerance of Ae. aegypti up to 40°C, the contribution of senescence may also play a role in the difference between our findings and [ 38].
